page.title: 05The College of Agriculture.
page.content: Moreton Hall became the proprety of Warwickshire C.C.in 1948. It covers 200 hectares (500acres) of which 170 hectares are farmed. Approximately 2/3 is grassland to support the animals the remainder is used for growing autumn sown winter wheat and barley. The heavy clay soil prevents the growing of autumn harvested cereals and root crops e.g. sugar beet. The college offers 9 courses to 250 full time students each year. A further 250 students are on part time courses. The college also provides courses for young farmers and also evening classes. Many school children visit the college each year to make brief studies of farming. About 17,000 people use the college facilities each year.
